   17: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   18: %% @author Maxim Fedorov <maximfca@gmail.com>
   19: %% Basic process tracing profiler tests.
   20: -module(tprof_SUITE).
   21: -author("maximfca@gmail.com").
   22: 
   23: %% Test server callbacks
   24: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0,
   25:          init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   26: 
   27: %% Test cases exports
   28: -export([
   29:     call_count_ad_hoc/0, call_count_ad_hoc/1,
   30:     call_time_ad_hoc/0, call_time_ad_hoc/1,
   31:     call_memory_ad_hoc/0, call_memory_ad_hoc/1,
   32:     lists_seq_loop/1, call_memory_total/1,
   33:     sort/0, sort/1,
   34:     rootset/0, rootset/1,
   35:     set_on_spawn/0, set_on_spawn/1, seq/1,
   36:     live_trace/0, live_trace/1,
   37:     patterns/0, patterns/1, pattern_fun/1, pattern_fun/2, pattern_fun/3,
   38:     processes/0, processes/1,
   39:     server/0, server/1,
   40:     hierarchy/0, hierarchy/1,
   41:     code_reload/0, code_reload/1,
   42:     code_load/0, code_load/1
   43: ]).
   44: 
   45: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   46: 
   47: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   48: %% COMMON TEST CALLBACK FUNCTIONS
   49: 
   50: suite() ->
   51:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 60}}].
   52: 
   53: all() ->
   54:     [call_count_ad_hoc, %% Cannot be run in parallel
   55:      {group, all}].
   56: 
   57: groups() ->
   58:     [{all, parallel(),
   59:       [call_time_ad_hoc, call_memory_ad_hoc,
   60:        call_memory_total, sort, rootset, set_on_spawn,
   61:        code_load, code_reload,
   62:        {group, default_session},
   63:        {group, custom_session}]},
   64:      {default_session,[],session()},
   65:      {custom_session,parallel(),session()}].
   66: 
   67: %% Because of scalability/performance issues in trace:info/3 we only run in parallel
   68: %% if we have a "small" amount of schedulers online.
   69: parallel() ->
   70:     [parallel || erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) < 64].
   71: 
   72: init_per_group(custom_session, Config) ->
   73:     [{session, ?MODULE} | Config];
   74: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
   75:     Config.
   76: 
   77: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
   78:     Config.
   79: 
   80: session() ->
   81:     [live_trace, patterns, processes, server, hierarchy].
   82: 
   83: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   84: %% TEST CASES
   85: 
   86: call_count_ad_hoc() ->
   87:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_count measurement"}].
   88: 
   89: call_count_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   90:     ct:capture_start(),
   91:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16]),
   92:     ct:capture_stop(),
   93:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
   94: 
   95:     %% We check that only the things profiled are lists:seq/2 and lists:seq_loop/3
   96:     %% and that the output looks good
   97:     ?assertMatch(
   98:        ["FUNCTION          CALLS  [    %]",
   99:         "lists:seq/2           1  ["++_,
  100:         "lists:seq_loop/3      5  ["++_,
  101:         "                         [100.0]"], Output),
  102: 
  103:     %% spawn examples
  104:     SpawnFun =
  105:         fun () ->
  106:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  107:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  108:        end,
  109:     %% trace subset examples
  110:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}],
  111:                                                  report => return, type => call_count}),
  112:     ?assertMatch({call_count, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{all, _, _}]}]}, Profile1),
  113: 
  114:     %% timer
  115:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, {call_count, Profile2}} = tprof:profile(
  116:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), receive after Delay -> ok end end,
  117:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_count }),
  118:     ?assertMatch([{lists, seq, 2, [{_, 1, _}]},
  119:                   {lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]},
  120:                   {?MODULE, _, _, _}], lists:sort(Profile2)),
  121: 
  122:     %% timer with patterns
  123:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile3} = tprof:profile(
  124:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  125:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_count,
  126:           pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}]}),
  127:     ?assertMatch({call_count, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{all, _, _}]}]}, Profile3).
  128: 
  129: call_time_ad_hoc() ->
  130:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_time measurement"}].
  131: 
  132: call_time_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  133:     ct:capture_start(),
  134:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 1000], #{type => call_time}),
  135:     ct:capture_stop(),
  136:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  137: 
  138:     %% We check that only the things profiled are lists:seq/2 and lists:seq_loop/3
  139:     ?assertMatch(
  140:        ["****** Process "++_,
  141:         "FUNCTION          CALLS  TIME"++_,
  142:         "lists:seq/2           1       "++_,
  143:         "lists:seq_loop/3    251       "++_,
  144:         "                              "++_],
  145:        Output),
  146: 
  147:     %% spawn examples
  148:     SpawnFun =
  149:         fun () ->
  150:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  151:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  152:        end,
  153:     %% trace subset examples
  154:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}],
  155:                                                  report => return, type => call_time}),
  156:     ?assertMatch({call_time, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]}]}, Profile1),
  157: 
  158:     %% timer
  159:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, {call_time, Profile2}} = tprof:profile(
  160:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), receive after Delay -> ok end end,
  161:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_time }),
  162:     ?assertMatch([{lists, seq, 2, [{_, 1, _}]},
  163:                   {lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]},
  164:                   {?MODULE, _, _, _}
  165:                  ], lists:sort(Profile2)),
  166: 
  167:     %% timer with filter
  168:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile3} = tprof:profile(
  169:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  170:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_time,
  171:           pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}]}),
  172:     ?assertMatch({call_time, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]}]}, Profile3).
  173: 
  174: call_memory_ad_hoc() ->
  175:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_memory measurement"}].
  176: 
  177: call_memory_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  178:     ct:capture_start(),
  179:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16], #{type => call_memory}),
  180:     ct:capture_stop(),
  181:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  182:     %% We check that only the things profiled are lists:seq/2 and lists:seq_loop/3
  183:     %% and that the output looks good
  184:     ?assertMatch(
  185:        ["****** Process "++_,
  186:         "FUNCTION          CALLS  WORDS  PER CALL  [     %]",
  187:         "lists:seq_loop/3      5     32      6.40  [100.00]",
  188:         "                            32            [ 100.0]"], Output),
  189:     %% spawn examples
  190:     SpawnFun =
  191:         fun () ->
  192:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  193:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  194:        end,
  195:     %% trace subset examples
  196:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_memory}),
  197:     ?assertMatch({call_memory, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, 64}]}]}, Profile1),
  198:     %% timer
  199:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
  200:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  201:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_memory}),
  202:     ?assertMatch({call_memory, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, 64}]}]}, Profile2).
  203: 
  204: lists_seq_loop(N) ->
  205:     [int_to_bin_twice(M) || M <- lists:seq(1, N)].
  206: 
  207: int_to_bin_twice(M) ->
  208:     B = integer_to_binary(M),
  209:     <<B/binary, B/binary>>.
  210: 
  211: %% Ensure total is not truncated,
  212: %% as per https://github.com/erlang/otp/issues/8139
  213: call_memory_total(_Config) ->
  214:     ct:capture_start(),
  215:     ok = tprof:profile(?MODULE, lists_seq_loop, [10000], #{type => call_memory}),
  216:     ct:capture_stop(),
  217:     ?assertNotMatch(nomatch, re:run(ct:capture_get(), " 15000[01] ")),
  218:     ok.
  219: 
  220: sort() ->
  221:     [{doc, "Tests sorting methods work"}].
  222: 
  223: sort(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  224:     %% sort examples
  225:     ct:capture_start(),
  226:     ok = tprof:profile(
  227:         fun () ->
  228:             Group = lists:seq(100, 120),
  229:             rand:uniform(hd(Group))
  230:         end, #{report => {process, {measurement_per_call, descending}}, type => call_memory}),
  231:     ct:capture_stop(),
  232:     Out = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  233:     %% measurement per call is 5th column
  234:     Col = 5,
  235:     Column5 = [string:to_integer(lists:nth(Col, Lexemes)) || Ln <- Out,
  236:         length(Lexemes = string:lexemes(Ln, " ")) >= Col],
  237:     WPC = [Words || {Words, []} <- Column5],
  238:     %% ensure descending sort
  239:     ?assertEqual(lists:reverse(lists:sort(WPC)), WPC).
  240: 
  241: rootset() ->
  242:     [{doc, "Tests rootset of processes supplied to ad-hoc profiler"}].
  243: 
  244: rootset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  245:     TestCase = random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  246:     {ok, Scope} = pg:start_link(TestCase),
  247:     Fun = fun () -> ok = pg:join(TestCase, lists:seq(1, 2), self()) end,
  248:     %% rootset tests
  249:     {ok, Profile} = tprof:profile(Fun, #{rootset => [TestCase], report => return, type => call_memory}),
  250:     TwoProcs = tprof:inspect(Profile),
  251:     ?assertEqual(2, maps:size(TwoProcs)), %% must be pg and "profiled process"
  252:     %% now trace all processes, existing and new
  253:     {ok, ProfAll} = tprof:profile(Fun, #{rootset => all, report => return, type => call_memory}),
  254:     %% at least tprof, pg2 and new profiled processes are traced
  255:     ?assert(map_size(tprof:inspect(ProfAll)) >= 3),
  256:     gen_server:stop(Scope).
  257: 
  258: set_on_spawn() ->
  259:     [{doc, "Tests tprof running with extra spawned processes"}].
  260: 
  261: set_on_spawn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  262:     %% profile a function that spawns additional process
  263:     {done, Profile} = tprof:profile(
  264:         fun () ->
  265:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  266:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  267:         end, #{report => return, set_on_spawn => false, type => call_memory}),
  268:     ct:log("~p",[Profile]),
  269:     {done, ProfileMFA} = tprof:profile(?MODULE, seq, [32],
  270:                                        #{report => return,
  271:                                          set_on_spawn => false,
  272:                                          type => call_memory}),
  273: 
  274:     ct:log("~p",[ProfileMFA]),
  275:     %% check totals
  276:     #{all := {call_memory, _G1, TotalProfile}} = tprof:inspect(Profile, total, measurement),
  277:     #{all := {call_memory, _G2, TotalProfileMFA}} = tprof:inspect(ProfileMFA, total, measurement),
  278:     %% only 1 process must be there
  279:     ?assertEqual(1, maps:size(tprof:inspect(Profile)), {set_on_spawn, Profile}),
  280: 
  281:     DownMsgSz =
  282:         case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  283:             8 -> 9;
  284:             4 -> 10
  285:         end,
  286:     DownMsgSzFl = DownMsgSz * 1.0,
  287:     %% check per-process stats
  288:     ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {_, 0}, 1, DownMsgSz, DownMsgSzFl, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfile)),
  289: 
  290:     %% MFA takes 4 more words. The memory of the 'DOWN' message is a bit racy,
  291:     %% so sometimes it will be there or not.
  292:     MfaSz = 4,
  293:     ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {seq, 1}, 1, Sz, SzAvg, _}
  294:                  when Sz =:= (DownMsgSz + MfaSz) andalso SzAvg == (DownMsgSz + MfaSz);
  295:                       Sz =:= MfaSz andalso SzAvg == MfaSz,
  296:                       lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfileMFA)).
  297: 
  298: seq(Max) ->
  299:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, Max) end),
  300:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end.
  301: 
  302: live_trace() ->
  303:     [{doc, "Tests memory tracing for pre-existing processes"}].
  304: 
  305: live_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  306:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config, #{type => call_memory}),
  307:     Pid = spawn_link(
  308:         fun () ->
  309:             receive
  310:                 {From, C} ->
  311:                     [lists:seq(1, 2) || _ <- lists:seq(1, C)],
  312:                     From ! {self(), done}
  313:             end
  314:         end),
  315:     _ = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, '_', '_'),
  316:     1 = enable_trace(Config, Srv, Pid),
  317:     Pid ! {self(), 12},
  318:     receive {Pid, done} -> ok end,
  319:     catch disable_trace(Config, Srv, Pid),
  320:     Profile = collect(Config, Srv),
  321:     ProcInspected = tprof:inspect(Profile),
  322:     %% white box check: list comprehension with 1-arity, and 100% allocation
  323:     %% tprof:format(user, ProcInspected),
  324:     #{Pid := {call_memory, 48, [{?MODULE, {_LC, 1}, 13, 48, _, 100.0}]}} = ProcInspected,
  325:     stop(Config, Srv).
  326: 
  327: patterns() ->
  328:     [{doc, "Tests pattern enable/disable correctness"}].
  329: 
  330: patterns(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  331:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config, #{type => call_memory}),
  332:     %% test errors
  333:     ?assertEqual({error, {not_traced, pg, get_members, '_'}}, clear_pattern(Config, Srv, pg, get_members, '_')),
  334:     ?assertEqual({error, {trace_pattern, ?MODULE, seq, 2}}, set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, seq, 2)),
  335:     %% successful patterns
  336:     1 = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, seq, 1),
  337:     3 = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, pattern_fun, '_'),
  338:     1 = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, pattern_fun, 2),
  339:     Expected = [{pattern_fun, 1}, {pattern_fun, 3}, {seq, 1}],
  340:     ?assertEqual(#{?MODULE => Expected}, get_trace_map(Config, Srv)),
  341:     %% verify tracing flags
  342:     verify_trace(Srv, [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Expected], [{?MODULE, pattern_fun, 2}]),
  343:     %% trace the entire ?MODULE module, and then exclude pattern_fun/1,2,3 and seq/1
  344:     _ = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, '_', '_'),
  345:     3 = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, pattern_fun, '_'),
  346:     1 = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, seq, 1),
  347:     Cleared = [{pattern_fun, 1}, {pattern_fun, 2}, {pattern_fun, 3}, {seq, 1}],
  348:     Traced = ?MODULE:module_info(functions) -- Cleared,
  349:     verify_trace(Srv, [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Traced], [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Cleared]),
  350:     %% clear all, which clears lists too
  351:     _ = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, '_', '_', '_'),
  352:     verify_trace(Srv, [], [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Traced ++ Cleared]),
  353:     ?assertEqual(#{}, get_trace_map(Config, Srv)),
  354: 
  355:     %% Trace the entire node then exclude pattern_fun/1,2,3 and seq/1
  356:     _ = set_pattern(Config, Srv, '_', '_', '_'),
  357:     ?assertEqual(all, get_trace_map(Config, Srv)),
  358: 
  359:     stop(Config, Srv).
  360: 
  361: verify_trace(Srv, On, Off) ->
  362:     [?assertEqual({call_memory, []}, trace:info(tprof:get_session(Srv),MFA, call_memory)) || MFA <- On],
  363:     [?assertEqual({call_memory, false}, trace:info(tprof:get_session(Srv),MFA, call_memory)) || MFA <- Off].
  364: 
  365: pattern_fun(Any) -> Any.
  366: pattern_fun(Any, Any2) -> {Any, Any2}.
  367: pattern_fun(Any, Any2, Any3) -> {Any, Any2, Any3}.
  368: 
  369: processes() ->
  370:     [{doc, "Tests that process management for enabling/disabling traces works"}].
  371: 
  372: processes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  373: 
  374:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config),
  375: 
  376:     Pid = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  377:     Pid2 = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  378:     Name = random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  379:     register(Name, Pid2),
  380:     %% test a mix of pids/registered processes/single PID calls
  381:     ?assertEqual(2, enable_trace(Config, Srv, [Pid, Name])),
  382:     ?assertEqual(0, disable_trace(Config, Srv, '$sure_not_exist')),
  383:     ?assertEqual({1, ['$sure_not_exist']}, enable_trace(Config, Srv, [Pid, '$sure_not_exist'])),
  384:     ok = gen:stop(Pid),
  385:     ok = gen:stop(Name),
  386: 
  387:     stop(Config, Srv).
  388: 
  389: server() ->
  390:     [{doc, "Tests for gen_server-based API"}].
  391: 
  392: server(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  393:     Name = random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  394: 
  395:     %% start an extra pg scope - we'll trace it during profiling
  396:     {ok, Scope} = pg:start_link(Name),
  397:     %% simulate existing process
  398:     Pid = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  399:     %% start the profiler
  400:     {ok, _Srv} = tprof:start_link(#{type => call_memory}),
  401:     %% test that ad-hoc profile can be run
  402:     ?assertEqual(ok, tprof:profile(fun() -> lists:seq(1,10) end)),
  403:     %% test live trace
  404:     1 = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, dispatch, '_'),
  405:     _ = tprof:set_pattern(pg, '_', '_'),
  406:     %% watch for pg traces and for our process
  407:     2 = tprof:enable_trace([Pid, Name]),
  408:     %% run the traced operation
  409:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [Name, group, Pid]}),
  410:     %% collect profile (can save it to a file for later analysis)
  411:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  412:     %% must not be empty, and must contain 3-words dispatch from this module,
  413:     %%  and at least something from pg in two processes
  414:     ?assertNotEqual([], FirstProfile),
  415:     ?assertEqual({?MODULE, dispatch, 2, [{Pid, 1, 3}]}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, FirstProfile)),
  416:     ?assertMatch({pg, handle_call, 3, [{Scope, _, _}]}, lists:keyfind(handle_call, 2, FirstProfile)),
  417:     ?assertMatch({pg, join, 3, [{Pid, _, _}]}, lists:keyfind(join, 2, FirstProfile)),
  418:     %% pause tracing
  419:     ok = tprof:pause(),
  420:     %% ensure paused by running more code but keeping the trace
  421:     %% ensure collection still returns the previous result
  422:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [Name, group, Pid]}),
  423:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  424:     %% continue, ensure new results are collected
  425:     ok = tprof:continue(),
  426:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, leave, [Name, group, [Pid, Pid]]}),
  427:     ?assertNotEqual({call_memory, FirstProfile}, tprof:collect()),
  428:     %% restart all counters from zero and ensure that we again collect the original data
  429:     ok = tprof:restart(),
  430:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [Name, group, Pid]}),
  431:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  432: 
  433:     %% test ad-hoc profiling can be done while running server-aided
  434:     %% for that, profiler should have very specific pattern
  435:     {_, AdHoc} = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 32], #{registered => false, pattern => {lists, '_', '_'},
  436:         report => return, type => call_memory}),
  437:     %% check totals: must be 64 words allocated by a single lists:seq_loop
  438:     ?assertMatch(#{all := {call_memory, 64, [{lists, _, _, 64, _, _}]}},
  439:                  tprof:inspect(AdHoc, total, measurement)),
  440:     %% verify that server-aided version still works
  441:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  442:     ok = tprof:stop(),
  443:     ok = gen_server:stop(Scope),
  444:     ok = gen:stop(Pid).
  445: 
  446: %% nano-gen-server purely for tracing
  447: spawn_loop() ->
  448:     receive
  449:         {'$gen_call', From, Call} ->
  450:             dispatch(Call, From),
  451:             spawn_loop();
  452:         {system, From, {terminate,normal}} ->
  453:             gen:reply(From, ok)
  454:     end.
  455: 
  456: dispatch({spawn_link, Fun}, From) ->
  457:     gen:reply(From, erlang:spawn_link(Fun));
  458: dispatch({apply, M, F, A}, From) ->
  459:     gen:reply(From, erlang:apply(M, F, A)).
  460: 
  461: hierarchy() ->
  462:     [{doc, "Tests tracing for process hierarchy"}].
  463: 
  464: hierarchy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  465:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config, #{type => call_memory}),
  466:     Traced = case enable_trace(Config, Srv, {all_children, kernel_sup}, #{ set_on_spawn => false }) of
  467:                  {T, _} -> T;
  468:                  T -> T
  469:              end,
  470:     ?assert(Traced > 5),
  471:     ?assert(set_pattern(Config, Srv, code_server, '_', '_') > 5),
  472:     _ = code:get_path(), %% makes a call to code_server
  473:     %% disabling all processes tracing should return more than "children of"
  474:     Disabled = disable_trace(Config, Srv, all),
  475:     ct:log("~p",[{Disabled, Traced}]),
  476:     ?assert(Disabled > Traced),
  477:     {call_memory, Profile} = collect(Config, Srv),
  478:     stop(Config, Srv),
  479:     ?assertNotEqual(false, lists:keyfind(handle_call, 2, Profile)).
  480: 
  481: code_reload() ->
  482:     [{doc, "Tests that collection does not fail for a hot-code-reloaded module"}].
  483: 
  484: code_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  485:     {_, {call_memory, Sample}} = tprof:profile(
  486:                                    fun () -> msacc:start(100), code:load_file(msacc) end,
  487:                                    #{report => return, type => call_memory}),
  488:     %% don't care about actual returned values, but do care that profile/2 does not crash
  489:     ?assertNotEqual([], Sample).
  490: 
  491: code_load() ->
  492:     [{doc, "Tests profiling works for modules loaded during profiling"}].
  493: 
  494: code_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  495:     code:purge(sofs),
  496:     code:delete(sofs),
  497:     {_, {call_memory, Sample}} =
  498:         tprof:profile(fun () -> sofs:relation([{b,1},{c,2},{c,3}]) end,
  499:                       #{report => return, type => call_memory}),
  500:     ?assertNotEqual(false, lists:keyfind(sofs, 1, Sample)).
  501: 
  502: -define(SESSION(A, B),
  503:         case proplists:get_value(session, Config) of
  504:             undefined ->
  505:                 A;
  506:             _Session ->
  507:                 B
  508:         end).
  509: 
  510: start_link(Config) ->
  511:     ?SESSION(
  512:        tprof:start_link(),
  513:        tprof:start_link(#{ session => _Session })).
  514: 
  515: start_link(Config, Opts) ->
  516:     ?SESSION(
  517:        tprof:start_link(Opts),
  518:        tprof:start_link(Opts#{ session => _Session })).
  519: 
  520: set_pattern(Config, Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg) ->
  521:     ?SESSION(
  522:        tprof:set_pattern(Mod, Fun, Arg),
  523:        tprof:set_pattern(Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg)
  524:       ).
  525: 
  526: clear_pattern(Config, Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg) ->
  527:     ?SESSION(
  528:        tprof:clear_pattern(Mod, Fun, Arg),
  529:        tprof:clear_pattern(Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg)
  530:       ).
  531: 
  532: enable_trace(Config, Srv, Spec) ->
  533:     ?SESSION(
  534:        tprof:enable_trace(Spec),
  535:        tprof:enable_trace(Srv, Spec, [])
  536:       ).
  537: 
  538: enable_trace(Config, Srv, Spec, Opts) ->
  539:     ?SESSION(
  540:        tprof:enable_trace(Spec, Opts),
  541:        tprof:enable_trace(Srv, Spec, Opts)
  542:       ).
  543: 
  544: disable_trace(Config, Srv, Spec) ->
  545:     ?SESSION(
  546:        tprof:disable_trace(Spec),
  547:        tprof:disable_trace(Srv, Spec, [])
  548:       ).
  549: 
  550: collect(Config, Srv) ->
  551:     ?SESSION(
  552:        tprof:collect(),
  553:        tprof:collect(Srv)
  554:       ).
  555: 
  556: get_trace_map(Config, Srv) ->
  557:     ?SESSION(
  558:        tprof:get_trace_map(),
  559:        tprof:get_trace_map(Srv)
  560:       ).
  561: 
  562: stop(Config, Srv) ->
  563:     ?SESSION(
  564:        tprof:stop(),
  565:        tprof:stop(Srv)
  566:       ).
  567: 
  568: random_name(Prefix) ->
  569:     list_to_atom(atom_to_list(Prefix) ++ "__" ++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer())).
  570:
